da98e085-0d05-58d0-becb-b118df507374.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor is to supply the product details to the Engineer for approval prior to installation on site.

9cf2c04f-6b7b-5a8f-ad22-1ccbd7d48338.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The SIL shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, Weathering Quality Index, and California Bearing Ratio.

73ade936-788b-5847-9cc2-e26a0f05e1fa.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The crushing resistance shall be not less than 100kN when the aggregate is tested in accordance with NZS:4407: Test 3.10

9b48e4a9-a39c-555b-ba51-f01d66107626.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The aggregate shall have a weathering quality index of AA, AB, AC, BA, BB or CA when tested according to NZS: 4407: Test 3.11.

04d65930-be75-529c-81ef-0052de539b3b.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The material shall have a minimum CBR of 40 when compacted to New Zealand heavy compaction standard in accordance with NZS4402 Test 4.1.2 at water content between 4% and 6% by weight of aggregate. CBR testing shall be in accordance with NZS 4407 Test 3.15.

9750a452-43c2-5f59-9260-66c87738b492.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The SIL shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Quality of Fine, Broken Face Content, Grading, Aggergate Fractions, and Be free of organic matter.

5bc6f250-9e90-5c0a-a2dc-7723367c68a0.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - In each of the aggregate fractions between the 63.0mm and 4.75mm sieves, not less than 50% by weight shall have two or more broken faces. It shall be free of organic matter.

74b09ca6-6fa5-5d2d-8399-df20d2c7619d.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The sand equivalent shall not be less than 30 when the aggregate is tested according to NZS 4407: 1991: Test 3.6. The sand equivalent test may be neglected if the grading test shows less than 4% passing the 75-micron sieve.

93d8b7d9-d42a-5572-a3c2-af6abd90e4c9.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Plasticity Index shall be no less than 8 when the aggregate is tested according to NZS 4407: Test 3.4.

baca95ff-1dac-54dc-83a7-9e1a57a7a382.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Clay Index shall be no less than 5 when the aggregate is tested according to NZS 4407: Test 3.5

ace9b97f-704b-57a6-a891-463a479b1bf6.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - When tested according to NZS: 4407: Test 3.8.1 Standard Method by Wet Sieving or Test 3.8.2 Subsidiary Method by Dry Sieving, the grading of the aggregate shall fall within their respective envelopes defined below or as directed by the Engineer.

e296e448-e098-515d-b486-0ea4eaaea638.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Maximum Dry Density (MDD) for SIL construction shall be the maximum laboratory dry density using Heavy compaction.

meta.name: 4.24 AP65 Subgrade Improvement Layer (SIL) - B/2 Materials (Pavement Type A,B,C)

dc69d1e9-48bf-5344-b426-77a7ae11dbd1.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The GAP65 SIL shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, Weathering Quality Index, and California Bearing Ratio.

99dcaa90-168b-5b39-a64c-f183770fb8c0.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The GAP65 SIL shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Quality of Fine, Broken Face Content, Grading, Aggergate Fractions, and Be free of organic matter.

4189073a-6eec-596c-a555-59fb9a5a6668.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Maximum Dry Density (MDD) for GAP65 SIL construction shall be the maximum laboratory dry density using Heavy compaction.

meta.name: 4.26 GAP65 Subgrade Improvement Layer - B/2 Materials

1b563a1a-eccd-5f77-9a9a-a9fbf9bed651.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Coarse Aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Weathering Quality Index, Crushing Resistance, Broken Faces, and Particle Size Distribution

63120355-0e29-5b3d-ad36-02b55dd1ae9b.title: Frequency - Source Properties every 10 000m3 / 1 per annum. Production Properties every 750 tonne.

meta.name: 4.29.01 - Coarse Aggregate - Property Tests and Sampling

f08b88bf-f2ab-5f16-9a3c-ffaa6d1cfff5.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Fine Aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, Sand Equivalent, and Particle Size Distribution

8eae82b1-ea3a-5d42-9e62-7898dd675fd3.title: Frequency - Source Properties every 10 000m3 / 1 per annum. Production Properties every 750 tonne.

meta.name: 4.29.02 - Fine Aggregate - Property Tests and Sampling

8b2fe52f-de16-5e48-955a-deb04f3801a7.title: Standard / Specification - PS 21.2.1 NZTA M10:2020 - 2.2 ASTM D242

fcfea0ff-f414-5711-af0f-ac43085463e0.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Filler shall be consistent in mineral composition. It shall be dry, and free from lumps, clay, organic matter or other material deleterious to asphalt.

88277355-6289-5909-aef4-4414f0aca2b9.title: Standard / Specification - PS 21.2.1 NZTA M10:2020 - 2.3.1, NZTA M01-A

a8b52c23-f0ed-50b7-873e-1dc16b3600f0.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The binder grade shall be a performance-graded binder complying with the requirements of NZTA M01-A specification.

f9b1da01-2ed4-54fd-a515-7550f0866e2a.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor’s mix design shall be assessed by the Engineer for compliance with the requirements of this specification including a production trial, job mix formula, and be currently Validated. The Engineer’s approval of the mix design is a prerequisite for its use.

bb2a4147-65d7-56af-b1b0-4cd4c125228a.title: Standard / Specification - PS 21.2.1, PS 20.7.5 NZTA M10:2020 - 3.1 , 3.6

27c0ced7-4842-55b5-9a40-bbaf2fd494e9.title: Frequency - No less than 10 working days prior to the pre-paving planning meeting

meta.name: 4.29 NZTA M10 2020 - DENSE GRADED ASPHALTIC CONCRETE MATERIALS

5ed5955f-dd73-5913-945d-bc44f9fdc891.title: Frequency - Source Properties every 10 000m3 / 1 per annum. Production Properties every 750 tonne.

4852b262-60a2-53b3-adb4-ad39fff91663.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Coarse Aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Weathering Quality Index, Crushing Resistance, Broken Faces, Bulk SG and Density, Absorption, and Particle Size Distribution

meta.name: 4.30.01 - Coarse Aggregate - Property Tests and Sampling

20df964e-81fb-5b0a-8bc2-63894d6750fc.title: Frequency - Source Properties every 10 000m3 / 1 per annum. Production Properties every 750 tonne.

b127d2dd-3132-56b5-a64e-fc9b0ff3f420.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Fine Aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, Sand Equivalent, Bulk SG and Density, Absorption, and Particle Size Distribution

meta.name: 4.30.02 - Fine Aggregate - Property Tests and Sampling

512be874-0e1c-5981-b3c8-11583753c105.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Filler shall be consistent in mineral composition. It shall be dry, and free from lumps, clay, organic matter or other material deleterious to asphalt.

f93d357a-6105-51b6-8e29-8a3da355ce61.title: Standard / Specification - PS 21.3.1 NZTA M27:2020 - 2.2 ASTM D242

7d7b046e-b206-52fc-8500-ca341b1d78d7.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The binder grade shall be a performance-graded binder complying with the requirements of NZTA M01-A specification.

f2f65a31-c141-5b25-bfbe-0aeeda009765.title: Standard / Specification - PS 21.3.1 NZTA M27:2020 - 2.4.1, NZTA M01-A

9e29d9e5-9fec-583b-a697-588dc02cc1d0.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor’s mix design shall be assessed by the Engineer for compliance with the requirements of this specification including a production trial, job mix formula, and be currently Validated. The Engineer’s approval of the mix design is a prerequisite for its use.

meta.name: 4.30 NZTA M27 2020 - STONE MASTIC ASPHALT MATERIALS

12ddbae4-a6c8-57d6-9c28-8f15745df60b.title: Frequency - One test per grade supplied

ad388c5f-35da-58b1-851c-439bfed0944c.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The binder grade shall be a performance-graded binder complying with the requirements of NZTA M01.

82b9a9df-0b41-588c-9575-4738ee2047f2.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Sealing Chip shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, Weathering Resistance, Weak Particles Test, Skid Resistance, and PSV

5d9d407d-9745-5642-810f-3ad2847c9892.title: Frequency - Before Supply and Every 10,000m3 Thereafter

meta.name: 4.32.01 - Sealing Chip - Source Property Tests and Sampling

d51bdca6-62a1-57ee-952a-2e0199f44fc2.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Sealing Chip shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Cleanness, Size and Shape, and PSD for G5 / G6

meta.name: 4.32.01 - Sealing Chip - Production Property Test Sampling

e1e1657d-79a2-579c-934d-fae225abc59e.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The binder grade shall be a performance-graded binder complying with the requirements of NZTA M01.

c20c3e73-a436-5575-8183-f3f8e864b753.title: Frequency - One test per grade supplied

732a614e-aa58-5838-8786-3af7d9628309.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The binder shall have benchmark parameter testing completed complying with the requirements of NZTA Q05.

b2aa1be1-7dd5-5b25-a83b-29cb9920e857.title: Frequency - Each Adhesion Agent and Dosage Rate for a Particular Chip Source

91125f69-3fc6-5685-8b8c-b597a9cf3f73.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - When used, Adhesion agents must be approved & blended in accordance with the requirements of TNZ M/13 Specification for Adhesion Agents.

56024763-74c0-5906-b7e8-d03880d84b3b.title: Verifying Document - Binder Aggregate Adhesion Test

a9f66d89-6015-5f99-9e2e-421dc138aaba.title: Standard / Specification - TNZ P3 TNZ P4

dda25e4d-4897-5f7b-897b-75c5ba3ca077.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The binder shall be applied with a bitumen distributor, operated in accordance with BCA E/2, Specification for Performance of Bitumen Distributors administered by the New Zealand Bitumen Contractors' Association Inc.

d535dfe4-2881-52f7-8274-5e12c197a561.title: ○ Source property testing shall beOnly one set is needed if HI-LAB40 and 65 come for the same source

b2f1406a-69a6-5409-8249-afcf794f7e62.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Hi-Lab aggregate shall be crushed from quarried rock and consist of hard, sound material of uniform quality, free from soft or disintegrated stone or other deleterious material.

84bfd323-f72c-57be-98bc-e2da0f0c99cf.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - AA, AB, AC, BA, BB or CA

7252a5f1-a220-5a18-bcf0-da9087e6fb24.title: ○ Note: If the result for the source rock exceeds 30%, further testing to detect the presence of smectite clays shall be carried out using X-ray diffraction. If the aggregate is shown contain trace amounts only of smectite clays (i.e. XRD <100 counts) then the source rock may be considered compliant with this criterion

9a2581b2-e318-5650-acb7-23964d08a3b5.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The solid density of the Hi-Lab shall be determined in accordance with NZS 4407 Test 3.7.1 Solid Density of Aggregate Particles.

208e68b3-f284-5be7-82c2-531a25deca5f.title: Frequency - Two tests per aggregate source then one test every 5,000m³

e489411e-85e6-5e70-8eb0-bd72e7dd5133.title: Standard / Specification - NZS 4407 Test 3.7.1 Solid Density of Aggregate Particles

c24aa2be-3b48-5da3-813e-0b3698274c62.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Hi-Lab 65 shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Quality of Fines, Broken Faces, Aggregate Flakiness Value, and Grading.

9dfa004f-6d68-5930-be22-a02a41597760.title: Frequency - Test for every 1,000 tonnes of material produced

d171a8d3-f0c4-5957-93e3-14e49d126377.title: ○ Note: Hi-Lab aggregate produced from a hard rock quarry source using angular and broken feedstock need not be tested for Broken Faces Content which may be assumed to be 100%.

18fb10b1-4127-5cdf-bae6-3c534bc67bc4.title: Frequency - Test for every 1,000 tonnes of material produced

b5cf3bfd-2292-5ed4-ad39-992e63313e6b.title: Frequency - Test for every 1,000 tonnes of material produced

24a3f1dd-b97f-5b67-a2cc-e2aaa5b31885.title: Frequency - Test for every 1,000 tonnes of material produced

d39365a7-7284-58e2-927d-5437db226c53.title: (a) The rolling average results of five consecutive test samples shall be within the upper and lower limits for each test sieve

967d394d-69fe-53e3-ab95-8af3e55aaa6c.title: Table 0.3 Hi-Lab 65 Particle Size Distribution Limits

4b184fa4-2cee-53ba-be84-5cf1229f43cb.title: Test results shall be evaluated as follows:

b186dd07-a6cd-5335-9b1f-e16b3e4ce08e.title: (b) No individual test result shall be outside the envelope formed by the lower buffer zone and the upper limit.

fdc7b7df-3475-5c6d-b201-76222ef25581.title: ○ Note: Experience has shown that a blending plant with a minimum of three component feed bins is required to produce a consistently compliant Hi-Lab aggregate product.

3bfe56c8-3505-51cd-b01a-137bdb9cf0bc.title: Frequency - Test samples shall be drawn and tested for every 1,000 tonnes produced. A minimum of 5 production test samples shall be drawn and tested for any one production lot.

d298569a-1e14-5f81-a68e-f2ba45215dcc.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The particle size distribution during production of the blended Hi-Lab products shall comply with the limits in Table 0.3.

b479058a-6aa4-596b-a9de-b08605d97df1.title: ○ A minimum sample of 90kg of aggregate shall be used for each test.

ff7d1e69-cff6-570e-afb9-16243c42c3a1.title: Sieve Size (mm) || Lower Buffer / Lower Limit / Upper Limit

7711dddd-e57a-5aa3-98e9-2dc17da4f026.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The percentage of flaky particles for each of the aggregate test fractions coarser than 9.50mm specified by AS 1141.15 Table 1 shall be determined and reported, and the Flakiness Value for each size fraction comply with the minimum requirement of Table 0.5:

6169527e-8a69-5ecb-99ea-d616deeae350.title: Table 0.5 Aggregate Flakiness Value Requirement for Each Fraction

bff48a57-5454-5b1e-8f91-f17302cf0e36.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Cement shall comply with NZS 3122 Specification for Portland and blended cements (general and special purpose) for GP, GB, LH

ce97cd43-ce9e-532d-b4bf-3c4ca9cc803d.title: ○ General purpose Portland cement, type GP, shall be used unless otherwise specified in the Contract Documents. Note that high-early strength cement, type HE, shall not be used as a stabilising agent.

2b441536-c914-5a0c-9ef1-eed48b317905.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall be responsible for ensuring that the water for stabilisation, construction and curing of stabilised layers is free from impurities that may deleteriously affect the setting, hardening or strength of the stabilised material. Water from sources other than public supply shall have its suitability established to the satisfaction of the Engineer.

49f5ccc8-dfd3-54b3-872f-5c01441fb314.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - PAP 7 crusher dust choking aggregate can be a by-product of the Hi-Lab crushing or sealing chip production with all passing the 9.5mm sieve. The aggregate source properties (crushing resistance and quality of fines) shall be equal to or better than the required source properties for Hi-Lab aggregate.

31bda933-2fce-547d-9d65-ff6bd7cefe05.title: Frequency - Test for every 1,000 tonnes of material produced

2bbec92d-5608-5ec6-a2cf-3a62db96626f.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The geogrid is to be checked once delivered to site to confirm there is no damage that may effect its performance. The material shall be stored out of direct sunlight to ensure no degradation of the material occurs prior to installation.

9116712a-94a2-510e-91de-3df88662413d.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The triaxial grid is to be installed in accordance with the manufacturer’s specification. Where overlaps are required they shall confirm with the manufacturers installation specification.

a9ae0c80-811d-5f37-9dd5-fbf5f09edfe4.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Dimensional tolerances, uniformity, contamination and segregation shall be Continuous monitored throughout

093376ec-2a4a-5ca6-9dff-ff3750702a7a.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The plateau density tests shall be undertaken on 100m test strips using a variety of compaction plant typical of that to be used on site. Testing shall be at OWC. The Contractor shall determine the minimum number of roller passes required to produce pavement layer compaction at OWC.

4e07b800-ad23-533b-8ca5-28aba15c5ceb.title: Verifying Document - MDD and Plateau Reports

886fb3c9-4234-57ce-891f-c38be85c8a0a.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The compaction density for the lower layers must be at least 81% of aggregate Solid Density. The nuclear gauge in direct transmission is used for reporting in-situ density.

2cbe1248-35ae-5973-89b7-91f54a443db1.title: Frequency - Min 5 Tests per lot 1000m2 max lot size

e469ce29-fdbb-5ba0-b02b-bea8977407d5.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The SIL layer shall be monitored for Layer thickness.

a597a4e3-9e3b-5139-9346-ba0ab7655e81.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The standard of smoothness shall be such that there is no point in the surface that varies more than 10 mm from a 3 m straight edge placed on the road and any deviation from the straight edge is gradual.

fdf63230-60d0-53d3-b547-01ca2a1bb037.title: Verifying Document - Survey / Straight edge Report

4cbca33b-5cfc-591b-95d1-af49b6418b43.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - No area of the completed surface shall have any depression that will allow water to pond where lateral or longitudinal fall is greater than 1%

69896ce4-39bb-5eef-b746-3888339f550e.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - SIL layers shall be proof rolled with a minimum 10 Tonne static weight smooth drum roller, or a heavy pneumatic tyred roller (PTR) to identify any soft spots. The criteria for acceptance of the sub-base proof rolling shall be a settlement under the tyre not exceeding 5mm for one pass.

58baeb5c-5260-51c0-bd2e-cb45fe4d7031.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - be ˂ 1.5mm (95th%) and max ≤1.8mm

meta.name: 13.02 AP65 Subgrade Improvement Layer Pavement Type A,B,C

57702c7a-c481-5930-be25-b7d5fe816a06.title: Frequency - Each Tanker For areas greater than 500m²

0239f5dc-4bb6-5eaa-bbc6-1ab28e9ae91e.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - For areas greater than 500m², cement shall be delivered to the site in purpose built bulk tankers unless otherwise approved by the Engineer. Each bulk tanker shall be issued a Certificate of Loading that contains the following information which shall form part of the project quality plan.

997610a5-de6f-5e15-ab9f-64d7e5f6031e.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The spreading equipment shall be capable of varying the spread width to cater for different road widths. The spread rate should be consistent along the spread width of the equipment.

meta.name: 13.04.02 - Plant for Spreading Chemical Stabilising Agents

a881e21d-55bc-5297-8d4f-634a4bbeed4d.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The plant used for the mixing shall be a purpose-built recycling machine. It shall be from a reputable manufacturer having a demonstrable track record and manufacturing history for the equipment used.

3766ac32-2f3a-5656-ac7d-832889e07e13.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - A steel drum roller (i.e. having a smooth drum) is required for the initial placement of aggregate. The roller shall have a gross weight of at least 12 tonnes. For primary compaction, the Contractor shall use GPS control to ensure all areas of the pavement receive the required number of passes with each type of roller.

fcc4a9fd-69bc-5f49-8995-b53a9d0ad5f9.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall submit a list of such personnel to the Engineer for approval. Where approved personnel are not available the Contractor shall cease operations.

769cbac5-e4ea-5594-98d2-18b35acdafb7.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Constructor shall construct a pavement test trial of Hi-Lab sub-base and basecourse pavement to verify design assumptions, material properties and construction methodology. The trial shall be undertaken in the presence of the Designer using the construction procedures, equipment and operating personnel proposed for the work in the placing, stabilising, compaction and finishing of the individual layers.

8fb913df-e151-5462-8336-1f6dbf5dc65f.title: Verifying Document - Conforming Trail and Test Results

f608f53a-107f-5656-9537-1a9a6f3da9eb.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall prepare a Production Plan for approval by the Engineer prior to commencement of delivery of Hi-Lab aggregate to site, detailing all aspects of its Hi-Lab production process, how it will achieve compliance with this specification, and procedures in the event of non-compliance or plant breakdown. The Production Plan shall include the Contractor’s detailed methodology.

a2fc03ed-e884-564a-85ea-e1faf3053f34.title: Frequency - Daily Prior to commencement of days work

a35e0141-717f-54da-b33e-f2197420a929.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Daily production sketches shall also be produced for approval by the Engineer ahead of each forthcomingday’s work.

e77e7364-ed09-5dba-8d6b-9d0719b1d5ed.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor is responsible for ensuring the surface level after spreading and compaction prior to stabilisation will result in final layer thickness and finished levels after stabilisation that are within the required tolerances.

7f9668b2-7dba-5f90-83c8-522aa29efe0e.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The cement spread rate shall be measued by a 1m² canvas Mat Test every 250m2 and be Within ±0.5kg/m² of the specified rate.

bf597ceb-3624-501f-9be5-7f3b97e94741.title: Frequency - Upon emptying the spreader and bulk tanker

c7c9d2cf-8535-5c94-ba97-94dcfb8a7b56.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Average usage of cement spread rate shall be measued by comparing tonnes used (from delivery docket) with measured area and be Within ±2.5% of the specified rate.

8b36d006-df09-59b7-81e6-f80c9edc460d.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Spreading of cement on the road ahead of stabilisation shall not continue when the cement becomes a dust problem due to dryness or when the wind speed exceeds 25km/hr. No spreading of cement shall commence if it is raining. If rain is likely to start before the cement can be mixed into the aggregate, then spreading shall not take place.

55c5a7c7-5e0d-593e-8880-1af2de735fc9.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The maximum time period, from mixing of the materials to completion of primary compaction, shall be 2.0 hours. Unless specifically justified in the approved Production Plan, stabilisation shall commence no later than 10:00 am and the area to be stabilized shall not exceed 4,000m² per day, unless agreed otherwise by the Engineer, to ensure sufficient time to complete the full stabilisation process.

fd26810f-0d7f-5f06-9c51-623f151382ed.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall continuously monitor the moisture content of the material behind the recycler and in consultation with the Engineer adjust the rate of water injection as necessary. The Contractor shall also monitor continuously for blocked nozzles or any other risk to the consistency of the mixture. The stabilisation area shall not exceed 4000m2 per day, with a maximum single stabilisation run length of 225m, unless agreed otherwise by the Engineer.

fba6f2d5-e29a-5331-ae64-4e5aef278e5f.title: ○ The maximum allowable variation from the specified depth of cut is –5mm and +15mm.

8d95cbfc-214b-5ce2-9442-8bfd82443869.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall determine the mixing depth so that the final stabilised layer thickness after compaction meets the contract requirements. During stabilisation the depth of the cut shall be physically measured at both ends of the mixing drum at least once every 50m. The measured stabilisation depth shall confirm full mixture of the placed Hi-Lab layer at full depth with no untreated materials present at the bottom of the test hole.

d6dcfc93-9ed3-5b4e-ab2e-e929022fd011.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - To ensure complete stabilisation across the full width of the road, longitudinal joints between successive cuts shall overlap by a minimum of 100mm or half the layer thickness, whichever is greater. Overlap width shall be increased if any dry material is noticed between runs. The locations of longitudinal joints shall be agreed between the Contractor and Engineer and recorded in the production plan.

5f42c5f5-f32a-5dab-97be-68bdd544faa2.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The exact location of the end of the cut shall be carefully marked. This mark shall coincide with the position of the centre of the mixing drum at the point at which the supply of cement ceased. To ensure continuity of the stabilised layer, the next successive cut shall be started 3m behind this mark. This tie-in length shall be reduced to 1m for stabilised layers older than 7 days. Cement shall be spread on the overlap for the next run.

c871987f-f9a3-5f0d-8728-dc9c9e1999ea.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall sample the material behind the stabiliser for particle size distribution analysis using the specified method below and advise the Engineer of the result as soon as practicable. The sample frequency shall be a minimum of 5 samples per 4000m2. The samples shall be representative of the full stabilised area.

908b6069-78d2-5975-b8b0-d5b264dc0c4f.title: Frequency - A minimum of 5 samples per 4000m2

e02129af-73c7-5990-a5bc-3b45a0741832.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Primary compaction shall be monitored for conformance to the methodology

37360509-3ba9-5b1d-a80f-d5505cb8edb1.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Secondary Compaction and Choking shall be monitored for conformance to the methodology

82e9dd74-c55d-5718-a147-72fa1cf5abe6.title: Frequency - Prior to placing next Hi-Lab layer and/or sealing

9a646307-caa3-5664-b156-aae460ea7653.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Fines shall be removed and broomed to produce a mosaic surface prior to placing the next Hi-Lab layer or sealing. The surface shall not have any loose fines and/or “caked” laminations of fines, and shall be a mosaic stone surface free of fines.

meta.name: 13.06.15 - Surface prior to placing next Hi-Lab layer and/or sealing

33abea90-78c4-5b1f-adc7-18f9e0b897da.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The surface shape of the completed pavement layer shall be such that, when all loose aggregate is removed, it conforms to the shape specified within the tolerances in Table 4.3.

1e4217de-ccd0-5620-8ccc-41455bb854c6.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The crossfall between two points more than 2.0m apart, transverse to the centreline, shall not depart from the design crossfall by more than 0.5%.

d3e849f4-52cf-5b02-83d9-b1e8ec82a91e.title: Frequency - at least 48 hours have passed following completion of secondary compaction

29422071-cc70-59e3-8e7c-fa375af4583b.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - No construction equipment shall be driven on any Hi-Lab aggregate layers until at least 48 hours have passed following completion of secondary compaction. At no time during the construction of the Hi-Lab pavement layers shall any haulage of earthworks and/or drainage construction activities e.g. excavators be allowed, only construction activities directly associated with the construction of the Hi-Lab layers, e.g. placement of aggregate.

ad41f35d-f1c5-5d50-910d-c51c57348f5d.title: Frequency - at least 48 hours have passed following completion of secondary compaction

a7b72a8d-f65f-55a0-bd01-3b8a43025bbb.title: (a) provide additional PAP7 running course, if required (using clause 10 of NZTA B02 as a guide)

346ee5e8-10d6-5fb0-93dd-02b070782cad.title: (b) keep the surface damp but not wet to prevent drying and ravelling

114c0e99-ca20-5c42-89e5-9f2c073696bc.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - For a minimum of 48 hours after stabilisation the Contractor shall

468e6bb2-9347-515d-b146-be6f50331575.title: (c) drag-broom the whole surface, keeping a balanced distribution of PAP7.

764e92bf-8378-5835-94cf-f2c2bc19a7db.title: Frequency - At least five (5) randomly selected areas per 4,000m² or part thereof. For lot sizes larger than 4,000m² additional testing shall be undertaken at a rate of 1 test per 1000m²

c20be1e0-5ce6-5d8e-bef8-21b5df91873b.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The degree of compaction for the Hi-Lab layer shall be determined by direct transmission, a hole shall be drilled to accommodate the probe to the full depth of the Hi-Lab layer and/or layers. The probe shall be set at increasing increments of 50mm and a measurement shall be recorded for each depth setting. This process shall be repeated twice with a 180 degree rotational off-set around the hole. Tests shall be Moisture corrected.

meta.name: 13.06.20 - Compaction Testing - Subbase and Basecourse - Moisture Corrected - Direct Transmission against Solid Density

a27435c5-611a-59da-bfa6-f4e49f0dde78.title: Frequency - A minimum of two core samples per 4,000m² or lot size, whichever is the lesser

20bafaf4-60f4-5107-8b4a-4c6f259e90f9.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - A minimum of two core samples per 4,000m² or lot size whichever is the lesser, shall be taken within 0.5m of the probe hole to be used for moisture correction. After oven drying to calculate moisture correct, the same core sample shall be used for ITS.

5f8ccfd1-cb72-5ab2-ad8d-d214067c7d25.title: Frequency - One core is required per 2,000m² lot or part thereof for each stabilised layer.

53b3bd1a-9bb1-55cc-9f9a-1676038ba6eb.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - After a minimum of 7 days post stabilisation the Contractor shall take 200mm diameter core samples from representative locations in the stabilised layers for Indirect Tensile Strength (ITS) testing. If the Hi-Lab basecourse is placed prior to 7 days after sub-base construction, both layers shall be cored together at least 7 days after basecourse construction.

2074b372-a16e-50b9-a322-7e6da39cdb0c.title: Frequency - Prior to Next Layer / Surfacing

dc26f065-d6bb-54fc-817b-7f5c87bc0867.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Benkelman beam testing shall be carried out on top of the Hi-Lab sub-base layers in accordance with TNZ T01 specification at 10m intervals in alternating wheel paths for all lanes, within 7 days after stabilisation. All measured deflection measurements from each construction lot shall meet 95 the percentile ≤ 0.4mm (max < 0.5mm)

8e65e8a9-0a8d-5f6f-bd76-8a6d28d6e949.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Benkelman beam testing shall be carried out on top of the Hi-Lab basecourse layers in accordance with TNZ T01 specification at 10m intervals in alternating wheel paths for all lanes, within 7 days after stabilisation. All measured deflection measurements from each construction lot shall meet 95 the percentile ≤ 0.3mm (max < 0.4mm)

e80f0130-a5da-5ea4-9978-90c6375ef92f.title: Frequency - Prior to Next Layer / Surfacing

9b191f50-6e09-5f86-bd4b-f0e4242c868e.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Before sealing, the Contractor shall advise the Engineer that the pavement surface has been prepared in accordance with this specification although final sweeping may not have been performed. The Engineer shall be given the opportunity to inspect the swept pavement surface for approval.

c71afffa-30f2-5466-b62c-415f334c344b.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - For in-service chip seal surfacing - the 100m moving average lane roughness of Hi-Lab basecourse shall not exceed a NAASRA (100m rolling avg/km) < 75 counts/km.

meta.name: 13.06.26 - Hi-Lab Basecourse Surface - Pre Asphalt NAASRA

de717161-9d17-5a8d-8935-8aac6b78298f.title: Frequency - After initial first coat sealing

be545ac3-31f8-5450-8969-0dedb0dcb1c8.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - No part of the surface of the Hi-Lab pavement shall deviate by more than 10mm from a 3m straight edge lying under its own weight on the road surface parallel to or perpendicular to the road centreline. Rutting shall be checked by independent testing specialist.

meta.name: 13.06.27 - Rut Measurements - After initial first coat sealing

3ece08c3-8e21-54d2-aa47-df5db647c823.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Constructor shall submit the asphalt pre-levelling methodology to the designer for review and approval prior to implementation.

82859049-bf5c-55d8-80cf-0c7ca8c42500.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Before sealing, the Contractor shall advise the Engineer that the pavement surface has been prepared in accordance with this specification although final sweeping may not have been performed. The Engineer shall be given the opportunity to inspect the swept pavement surface for approval.

4d1aa2ab-4174-529e-b88a-3c415d5aa4db.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - For asphalt in-service surfacing - the roughness requirements on SMA or Epoxy modified OGPA final surfacing shall be NAASRA (100m rolling avg/km) < 50 and max NAASRA < 60.

meta.name: 13.06.30 - Hi-Lab Basecourse Surface - Final Asphalt Surface NAASRA

eba62781-3021-5d5d-bd75-6f3a14cde2b5.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - No part of the surface of the Hi-Lab pavement shall deviate by more than 10mm from a 3m straight edge lying under its own weight on the road surface parallel to or perpendicular to the road centreline. Rutting shall be checked by independent testing specialist.

e18d0868-8ea9-5f15-9c8f-921968fc566b.title: Frequency - Prior to final EMOGPA or SMA surfacing

meta.name: 13.06.31 - Rut Measurements - Prior to final EMOGPA or SMA surfacing

e87996a4-d456-578f-bcd1-27328268eea2.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - No part of the surface of the Hi-Lab pavement shall deviate by more than 10mm from a 3m straight edge lying under its own weight on the road surface parallel to or perpendicular to the road centreline. Rutting shall be checked by independent testing specialist.

f67a05c5-ee2e-5a52-9004-330659cffa8a.title: Frequency - After 12 months of trafficking on final surface

meta.name: 13.06.32 - Rut Measurements - After 12 months of trafficking on final surface

eb56fdd6-38cc-5c90-8a08-3de4de64949c.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - No part of the surface of the Hi-Lab pavement shall deviate by more than 10mm from a 3m straight edge lying under its own weight on the road surface parallel to or perpendicular to the road centreline. Rutting shall be checked by independent testing specialist.

0bc6d5a1-3f14-5b50-b7fc-fc8bddd937dd.title: Frequency - At the end of the Defects Notification Period.

meta.name: 13.06.33 - Rut Measurements - At the end of the Defects Notification Period.

6e9a546b-5e03-5a7d-8b82-e1568a1f3a36.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - No less than 48 hours prior to the commencement of asphalt construction a pre-paving planning meeting shall be held

31684294-c7fe-57e7-8ea1-253b87057204.title: Frequency - No less than 48 hours prior to the commencement of asphalt

ea18619d-1350-58df-a01c-0eca4b0dbba9.title: Standard / Specification - M/1, M/6, M/13, P/3, P4, P17, and Q/1.

6c29118c-9c41-5f7f-9ed9-9f9d48796de2.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Sealing shall be carried out in accordance with TNZ or NZTA Specifications M/1, M/6, M/13, P/3, P4, P17, and Q/1.

c025f9b6-94ad-50cf-934f-9e48eb799e23.title: Standard / Specification - TNZ P3 TNZ P4

616aa30d-4767-5842-b95a-6863d10a0ac1.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The sealing design including binder application rate to suit the surface conditions shall be approved by the Design Engineer prior to sealing.

63cc351d-21ab-5581-9d02-7b58c190b4ec.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The seal coat shall not be applied unless the water content at each test point of the basecourse layer is such that the degree of saturation (DOS) is less than 60%.

fdd5b534-070b-5a7b-ac9d-311af14d5c0e.title: Frequency - Min 5 Tests Per Lot 1000m2 Max Lot Size

ddbe441b-46c7-5b7a-b96a-22ff1f8f1ac7.title: Standard / Specification - TNZ P3 TNZ B02

ac047767-f2ad-5706-aded-35435f155fa4.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The road shall be reasonably dry before the binder is applied, and no spraying with asphaltic binder shall be carried out when the air temperature measured within the confines of the sealing course is below 10oC in the shade. The Engineer shall be given the opportunity to inspect the site.

5b89c251-f3f5-5abb-9404-fffeee1203ed.title: Frequency - A minimum of 24 hours’ notice of intention to seal.

4b5e607c-7da8-58d0-8b2a-353178af1906.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The emulsified asphalt may be sprayed at the temperature at which it is received from the manufacturing plant except that no emulsified asphalt shall be sprayed at a temperature in excess of 90oC or below 20oC.

f5673836-6d4e-5293-8542-ec0b957237df.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - A minimum of two samples per bitumen distributor load shall be taken. The first of these samples shall be taken at the end of the initial spray run and the other immediately before the final spray run. Bitumen to be tested on Engineers instruction.

0e82f0ba-9d87-5d2d-a957-98f6d6bf2b3f.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The quantity of binder sprayed in any spray run, measured by dipstick reading, shall not vary from the amount directed by more than 50 litres plus 4% of the amount directed.

9baa86b2-113d-554b-baaa-414cfbffb601.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All binder sprayed shall be covered with chips across the full sprayed width, apart from necessary longitudinal laps, within five minutes of spraying.

c66e6121-a8f4-559b-8dc0-7bbd6e5371d5.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Surplus chips shall be removed from the sealed surface prior to the removal of the temporary speed restriction signs.

e5735f64-5932-5158-8455-112fac082693.title: Frequency - 24 hours of Completion of any Section of Seal.

2f31c452-8457-572f-add6-46416ef12425.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Engineer will inspect the sealcoat immediately prior to the removal of the temporary speed restriction and after final surplus chip removal is completed.

20704127-6ca2-5b02-8bf7-8dd7f269851a.title: Frequency - Prior to TM Removal and After Final Sweeping

b456384e-8f8f-5b99-bd41-baa3c3699362.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall make no repairs without the prior approval of the Engineer for the methods to be used.

755354da-fd78-5ee1-bfae-672bb2d8674b.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Where a construction trial is specified in the contract, and not less than two days before the site work is due to commence, all the Contractor’s plant and personnel proposed for use on the job shall carry out a construction trial in the presence of the Engineer. Asphalt manufactured in the production trial can also be used in the construction trial if it meets the requirements of the specification.

c44b2cf7-fd31-5aaf-a286-9d922dec94df.title: Frequency - As Required, two days before the site work is due to commence.

1fd23c99-3a1c-5f22-87f3-bdb96d0fce10.title: Frequency - 7 days prior to construction of the asphalt pavement.

5dce77ae-08dd-50a8-8ac3-b70d88e9ae1d.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall prepare and submit a paving plan to the Engineer for approval not less than 7 days prior to construction of the asphalt pavement.

30bc743d-9cbf-5a11-b25c-f118e3de7988.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The surface on which the paving is to be laid shall be free from standing water, and any loose material, dust, clay or foreign matter shall be removed by sweeping. All fatty and unsuitable patches shall be removed. Depressions and other irregularities shall be patched or corrected.

meta.name: 14.03.03 - Preparation of Area to be Paved

59cc36da-2125-51fd-acca-cf5bccdc62f0.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall prevent tack coat, binder, aggregate, asphalt or other material used on the work from entering, adhering or obstructing gratings, hydrants, valve boxes, inspection pit covers, kerbs and other road fixtures

6f4918a9-598a-5dfc-b5af-e751d7b4d512.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Wearing course asphalt shall not be placed when the pavement surface temperature is less than 10°C, for SAC the minimum temperature is 5°C

bd33b60e-eb31-548c-9a31-606814ff90ef.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Tack coat shall be applied to the cleaned surface prior to placing asphalt. Tack coats shall be applied using a distributor. The use of a hand lance shall be minimised to ensure an even application of the tack coat.

8b00d341-891b-55ce-8de2-75deaf10bda7.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Conforming Grading and Binder content by mass. Refer clause 5.2 and table 5.2 for frequency and tolerances

meta.name: 14.03.07 - Asphalt Production Conformance - Grading and Binder

f39db1c7-4993-5a3c-b17b-fccf87716a6e.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Conforming Volumetric testing. Refer clause 5.2 and table 5.2 for frequency and tolerances

6298bfd8-46ec-5ceb-8b6b-ee90a7d8f3dd.title: Standard / Specification - NZTA M10:2020 - Table 3.1, 5.1 and 5.2

d41599f9-6434-543c-9288-bf9f6571e0a4.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The layer thickness determined from measurements on the cores is LCV of no less than the specified thickness - refer clause 9.7

aa70c97b-5a76-52bd-89e1-009b7e8ed1aa.title: Frequency - Mat - min 8 per lot (day) (1 for every 300 m²) Joints - min 3 per lot (1 for every 100m)

f4f90a13-2e6d-59aa-92a4-00f2b3ab4989.title: Frequency - min 3 per lot (day) (1 per 100 m of joint)

3df80193-31d7-53b9-bbb7-75ea17b4507f.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 150 mm nominal diameter Cores shall be taken from randomly located distances along joints at the rate of one per 100m of joint with a minimum of three representing each lot

077ac7c2-8709-56cd-ad9c-c9e168b7e7be.title: Frequency - within 24 hours of them being cut from the pavement

c534caf8-3c2b-5b0d-8010-8693dee91b37.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The upper and lower characteristic values of in-situ air voids for that lot shall comply within the maximum and minimum characteristic limits specified in Table 9.2

1f737c6b-18c3-5667-a544-e777f444ee21.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NDMs are to be completed at the time of placing to ensure compliance when cores are taken

d1c323bd-c758-59e7-810f-9deda31d8137.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The transverse truth of the surface shall be checked with a 3 m straight edge over the straight cross-fall portion of the cross-section for irregularities, which vary more than 5 mm under this straight edge.

4afe1778-5919-5248-a589-001b6d6007b1.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The level at the top of each layer of asphalt, horizontal location of any point on the pavement, and specified layer thickness shall be surveyed and conform with tolerances and contract requirements.

meta.name: 14.03.14 - Finished Pavement Level, Alignment, and Thickness
14.03 Construction Activity - NZTA M10 - Specification for dense-graded asphaltic concrete

22f18b53-cdde-5176-989d-bc9eefe59580.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Where a construction trial is specified in the contract, and not less than two days before the site work is due to commence, all the Contractor’s plant and personnel proposed for use on the job shall carry out a construction trial in the presence of the Engineer. SMA manufactured in the production trial can also be used in the construction trial provided that it meets the requirements of the specification.

f77558d1-84df-5611-a8dc-93a372845be3.title: Frequency - As Required, two days before the site work is due to commence.

1af04a12-0a74-5be1-8fb6-83871eaf8715.title: Frequency - 7 days prior to construction of the asphalt pavement.

b1ec0608-365d-5bb2-b67f-c421c09d3dba.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall prepare and submit a paving plan to the Engineer for approval not less than 7 days prior to construction of the asphalt pavement.

All fatty and unsuitable patches shall be removed. Depressions and other irregularities shall be patched or corrected.

81bac104-b334-5a45-9d63-64b21af8359d.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Wearing course asphalt shall not be placed when the pavement surface temperature is less than 10°C,

7953cf7a-36aa-5799-8c61-43f0a69dc313.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Tack coat shall be applied to the cleaned surface prior to placing asphalt. Tack coats shall be applied using a distributor. The use of a hand lance shall be minimised to ensure an even application of the tack coat. Where SMA is to be spread over clean, freshly placed asphalt, the Engineer can direct the Contractor to omit the tack coat.

4cd24579-d854-5a5b-aba2-9562cb3a34f8.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The layer thickness determined from measurements on the cores is LCV of no less than the specified thickness - refer clause 9.7

14.04 Construction Activity - NZTA M27 - Specification for stone mastic asphalt.

0fd10073-e696-55ad-8e1c-5a1f2759847e.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Target is an average of 60 NAASRA counts/km for the 100m moving average Maximum 100m moving average of 70 NAASRA counts/km. No 20m reading in any lane shall exceed 100 NAASRA counts/km.

93e626fc-8c78-56ca-9ea1-1a376c437383.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Target is an average of 50 NAASRA counts/km for the 100m moving average Maximum 100m moving average of 60 NAASRA counts/km. No 20m reading in any lane shall exceed 100 NAASRA counts/km.

fb9471c2-bef1-59b2-9536-5b222dc32078.title: Verifying Document - Prior to Project Completion

50d227a1-059d-5891-a73b-ee069d0a3343.title: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The surfacing shall meet the requirements specified in the Transport Agency’s T10:2010 Skid Resistance Deficiency Investigation and Treatment Selection, and any other subsequent amendments.
